newsitem.title: GREECE: GREECE HOPES "ONE STOP SHOP" WILL BOOST INVESTMENTS.
newsitem.headline: GREECE HOPES "ONE STOP SHOP" WILL BOOST INVESTMENTS.

text.p: Greece has put together a new flexible organisation -- the Hellenic Centre for Investment (HCI) or "one stop shop" -- to cut down on red tape for large private investments, officials said on Tuesday.

HCI's Chairman Nikos Skoulas told the Hellenic-American Chamber of Commerce conference that potential investments exceeding three billion drachmas will be handled directly by the HCI which will advise investors and handle the paper work with governmental bodies.

"Investors will get all the necessary information they want through the HCI free of charge and don't have to look elsewhere. We will show them how to take advantage of development laws and assist them in securing licences," he said.
HCI was formed in early 1996 but will operate at full speed at its permanent premises at the centre of Athens in December.

"As far as U.S. investments in Greece are concerned the main issue is to feel wanted. Not only on a national level but also on a municipal level or a community level. Then we need good, solid information," said Patrick Santillo, Commercial Councellor at the U.S. embassy in Athens.
